item.title: 阿波罗出价 110 亿美元收购派拉蒙好莱坞工作室
item.description: 私募股权公司阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）出价 110 亿美元收购派拉蒙全球旗下的电影制片厂派拉蒙影业公司（Paramount Pictures），使这家媒体集团的收购兴趣更加浓厚。【原文：Private equity firm Apollo Global Management has offered $11 billion for Paramount Global's film studio, Paramount Pictures, adding to the takeover interest for the media conglomerate.】

item.title: 日经》报道：日本央行下一次加息可能在 7 月或 10 月
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周四报道，日本央行可能在 7 月或 10 月加息，但 10 月加息的可能性更大，因为这将给日本央行大约半年的时间来评估加息的影响。【原文：The Bank of Japan is likely to hike the interest rate in either July or October, though an October hike is considered more likely, as it would give the BOJ around half a year to evaluate the impact, Nikkei newspaper reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 2 面对通胀高企，美联储维持利率不变，并对 2024 年降息持保留意见
item.description: 美联储周三维持利率稳定，但决策者们表示，尽管在实现美国央行2%的通胀目标方面的预期进展较为缓慢，他们仍预计到2024年底将利率下调四分之三个百分点。【原文：The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady on Wednesday, but policymakers indicated they still expect to reduce them by three-quarters of a percentage point by the end of 2024 despite stodgier expected progress towards the U.S. central bank's 2% inflation target.】

item.title: 美国 ETF 发行商急于为投资者提供押注美国科技大盘股的新方法
item.description: 资产管理公司正在推出新的交易所交易基金（ETF），试图为投资者提供更多的方式来博弈美国超大市值科技股的繁荣。【原文：Asset management companies seeking to offer investors still more ways to play the boom in U.S. mega-cap technology stocks are rolling out new exchange-traded funds (ETFs).】

item.title: CBO 称美国 30 年赤字增长速度将因支出上限和 GDP 增速而放缓
item.description: 美国国会预算办公室周三表示，随着利息成本的增加，未来30年美国的赤字和债务将大幅增长，但由于国会通过了支出限额，而且预计经济增长将更加强劲，因此与去年6月的预测相比，美国的赤字和债务前景有所改善。【原文：The Congressional Budget Office said on Wednesday that U.S. deficits and debt will grow considerably over the next 30 years as interest costs mount, but the outlook had improved from forecasts made last June due to spending limits passed by Congress and stronger projected economic growth.】

item.title: 美联储决策者坚持 24 年降息三次的观点，但勉为其难
item.description: 根据周三公布的新经济预测中值，美国央行行长们仍预计今年将降息三次，但总体上已变得比三个月前他们上次公布预测时更加鹰派。【原文：U.S. central bankers still anticipate cutting interest rates three times this year, according to the median of new economic projections published on Wednesday, but overall have become more hawkish than three months ago when they last published forecasts.】

item.title: 家属称，Binance 高管在尼日利亚出庭后仍被拘留
item.description: 世界上最大的加密货币交易所 Binance 的两名高管在周三首次出庭后，将在尼日利亚至少再被拘留两周，尽管他们没有被指控犯罪，他们的家人说。【原文：Two executives from Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, will remain in detention for at least two more weeks in Nigeria after appearing in court for the first time on Wednesday and even though they have not been charged with a crime, their families said.】

item.title: NRF 表示，2024 年美国零售额增长速度将放缓
item.description: 美国零售业联合会（National Retail Federation）周三表示，今年美国零售销售额预计将增长多达 3.5%，增速将低于 2023 年，原因是通胀持续高企抑制了消费者支出强劲复苏的希望。【原文：U.S. retail sales are expected to rise as much as 3.5% this year, a slower pace than 2023, industry body National Retail Federation said on Wednesday, as sticky inflation dampens hopes of a strong recovery in consumer spending.】

item.title: 对冲基金 Palliser 聘用前 Elliott 合伙人 Kasoff
item.description: 英国对冲基金 Palliser Capital 正在向美国扩张，并于周三表示聘请了史蒂夫-卡索夫（Steve Kasoff），这位前埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）合伙人将加入该公司，负责评估美国当前的机遇和新机遇。【原文：UK hedge fund Palliser Capital is expanding into the U.S. and said on Wednesday it hired Steve Kasoff, bringing on board a former Elliott Investment Management partner to evaluate current and new opportunities in the United States.】

item.title: 超微公司折价发行股票后股价下跌
item.description: 超微计算机公司周三股价下跌了 5%，此前这家人工智能服务器制造商宣布了其公开发行股票的定价，股票售价比最近的收盘价打了折扣。【原文：Super Micro Computer's shares fell 5% on Wednesday after the AI server maker announced the pricing of its public stock offering, selling the shares at a discount to their most recent closing price.】

item.title: Synopsys 称新工具有助于更快地设计汽车和数据中心
item.description: Synopsys 公司周三展示了一套软件工具，旨在使汽车、数据中心和其他依赖半导体的大型系统的设计变得更简单、更快捷。【原文：Synopsys on Wednesday showed a set of software tools designed to make it easier and faster to design cars, data centers and other big systems that rely on semiconductors.】

item.title: 独家报道：易捷航空首席执行官称正与欧盟委员会商讨接管利纳特机场机位事宜
item.description: 易捷航空（EasyJet）首席执行官周三表示，该公司正在与欧盟委员会商谈接手米兰利纳特机场机位的事宜，这是目前围绕汉莎航空入股 ITA 航空公司的补救措施进行的讨论的一部分。【原文：EasyJet is in talks with the European Commission about taking over slots at Milan's Linate airport as part of ongoing discussions on remedies surrounding Lufthansa taking a stake in ITA Airways, the carrier's chief executive said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 铂金金属面临电动汽车革命带来的结构性需求冲击
item.description: 按照惯例，铂金和钯金在从最近的峰值下滑之后，本应转而走高，因为供应不足、裁员以及头号生产国南非的矿场即将关闭。但事实并非如此，这说明电动汽车革命对需求预测的冲击有多大。【原文：In the usual way of things, platinum and palladium should be turning higher after a slide from recent peaks drove supply deficits, job cuts and looming mine closures in top producer South Africa. That they're not shows how hard the electric car revolution has hit demand forecasts.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Reddit 指南的 IPO 价格可能在区间顶部或以上
item.description: 据一位熟知内情的消息人士透露，Reddit 及其银行家正在指导该社交媒体平台的首次公开募股（IPO）定价，他们可能会将定价定在指示区间的顶端或更高。【原文：Reddit and its bankers are guiding that they could price the social media platform's initial public offering (IPO) at the top of the indicated range or above, according to a source familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国放宽尾气排放规定，放缓电动汽车过渡期至 2030 年
item.description: 拜登政府将于本周三公布最终规则，使汽车制造商更容易继续销售汽油动力车型，并放慢到 2030 年向电动汽车过渡的步伐。【原文：The Biden administration is unveiling final rules on Wednesday that make it easier for automakers to continue selling gas-powered models and slows the projected transition to electric vehicles through 2030.】

item.title: 爱马仕因 Birkin 手袋销售遭反垄断集体诉讼
item.description: 法国奢侈品牌爱马仕（Hermes）在加利福尼亚被起诉，声称该公司只允许有 "足够购买记录 "的顾客购买其著名的 Birkin 手袋。【原文：French luxury house Hermes has been sued in California over claims it unlawfully allows only customers with "sufficient purchase history" with the company to buy its famed Birkin handbags.】

item.title: FTX 创始人山姆-班克曼-弗里德并非 "超级恶棍"，他的律师如是说
item.description: 破产的加密货币交易所 FTX 创始人山姆-班克曼-弗里德（Sam Bankman-Fried）的律师在下周对其宣判前表示，山姆-班克曼-弗里德不是 "超级恶棍"，不应该像检察官提议的那样在监狱里度过 "中世纪 "的 40 到 50 年。【原文：Sam Bankman-Fried is no "super-villain" and should not spend a "medieval" 40 to 50 years in prison as prosecutors propose, lawyers for the founder of bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange FTX said in advance of his sentencing next week.】

item.title: 苏里南敦促埃克森公司和道达尔能源公司联合开发天然气
item.description: 苏里南国有石油公司负责人周二晚些时候告诉路透社，苏里南国有石油公司Staatsolie已开始与石油巨头埃克森美孚（Exxon Mobil）和道达尔能源（TotalEnergies）谈判，鼓励联合开发跨越苏里南和圭亚那海上边界的天然气田。【原文：Suriname's state-owned oil company Staatsolie has begun talks with oil majors Exxon Mobil and TotalEnergies to encourage joint development of natural gas fields that straddle its and Guyana's maritime borders, the head of its state oil firm told Reuters late Tuesday.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯-奔驰将在拉施塔特工厂测试 11 兆瓦时电池，以利用电力波动
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）周三表示，从 2025 年起，该公司将在德国拉施塔特（Rastatt）汽车厂测试 11 兆瓦时（MWh）的电池，以帮助弥补可再生能源输出波动与生产需求之间的差距。【原文：Mercedes-Benz said on Wednesday it will test an 11 megawatt hour (MWh) battery at its Rastatt car factory in Germany from 2025 to help bridge the gap between swings in renewable energy output and its manufacturing requirements.】

item.title: 政策不确定性促使投资者转向美国中期债券基金
item.description: 由于美联储政策路径的不确定性促使投资者在收益和保护之间寻找平衡点，投资者正蜂拥而至美国中期政府债券基金，并帮助将其资产推向历史新高。【原文：Investors are flocking to U.S. medium-term government bond funds and helping push their assets to record highs, as uncertainty about the Federal Reserve's policy path prompts them to seek the sweet spot between income and protection.】

item.title: 美国医疗行业最大的网络攻击事件
item.description: 2 月 21 日，联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）技术部门遭到黑客攻击，导致小型医疗服务提供商资金紧张，美国卫生部门也开始调查是否存在受保护健康数据泄露事件。【原文：Disruptions from the Feb. 21 hack at UnitedHealth Group's tech unit created a cash crunch for small healthcare providers and led to a U.S. health department probe into whether there was a breach of protected health data.】

item.title: 不良贷款消失，欧洲收债公司面临清算
item.description: 由于银行贷款变质的数量急剧下降，欧洲的讨债公司从盛宴走向饥荒。【原文：Europe's debt collectors have gone from feast to famine amid a collapse in the number of bank loans turning sour.】

item.title: 耐克销售额将出现罕见下滑，重点关注美国需求和直接面向消费者的举措
item.description: 本周四，耐克公司预计将公布近两年来首次季度营收下滑，其直接面向客户（DTC）战略的推动力低于预期，以及北美市场需求疲软成为焦点。【原文：Nike is projected to post its first quarterly revenue decline in nearly two years on Thursday, turning the spotlight on the slower-than-expected boost from its direct-to-customer (DTC) strategy and sluggish demand in North America.】

item.title: 花旗集团财富部门从瑞银集团挖来温特劳布领导家族办公室团队
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份备忘录，花旗集团从瑞银集团（UBS）聘请理查德-温特劳布（Richard Weintraub）为其财富管理集团负责人，负责美洲地区的家族办公室。【原文：Citigroup hired Richard Weintraub from UBS to head its wealth management group catering to family offices in the Americas, according to a memo seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国宽带供应商将开始提供新的比较标签
item.description: 根据美国联邦通信委员会（FCC）的新规定，从 4 月 10 日起，美国主要宽带互联网提供商必须开始显示类似于食品营养标签的信息，以帮助消费者选购服务。【原文：Major U.S. broadband internet providers must start displaying information similar to nutrition labels on food products to help consumers shop for services starting on April 10, under new rules from the Federal Communications Commission (FCC).】

item.title: 独家报道瑞安航空的奥利里将于周三晚些时候会见波音公司高级管理人员
item.description: 瑞安航空公司首席执行官迈克尔-奥利里（Michael O'Leary）周三表示，随着美国飞机制造商危机的加深，他将于当天晚些时候在都柏林会见波音公司的高级管理人员，讨论飞机交付长期拖延的问题。【原文：Ryanair CEO Michael O'Leary said on Wednesday he will meet with senior Boeing executives later in the day in Dublin to discuss prolonged delays in plane deliveries as a crisis at the U.S. planemaker deepens.】

item.title: 兴登堡研究公司披露数据中心运营商 Equinix 的空头头寸
item.description: 兴登堡研究公司（Hindenburg Research）周三披露了对 Equinix 的空头头寸，称这家数据中心运营商的交易价格处于高位，夸大了一项关键的盈利指标，并面临着包括亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）在内的大型云计算公司的激烈竞争。 Equinix 的股价在盘前交易中下跌了 6%，而其竞争对手 Digital Realty 的股价则下跌了 4%。【原文：Hindenburg Research disclosed a short position in Equinix on Wednesday, saying the data center operator trades at elevated levels, has overstated a key profitability metric and faces strong competition from large cloud firms, including Amazon.com. Equinix's shares fell 6% in premarket trading, while shares of its rival Digital Realty dropped 4%.】

item.title: Kyowa Kirin 的基因疗法以 430 万美元的价格成为美国最昂贵的药物
item.description: 日本协和麒麟公司（Kyowa Kirin）旗下的 Orchard Therapeutics 公司周三将其新获批的治疗一种罕见、危及生命的遗传病的基因疗法定价为 425 万美元，成为美国最昂贵的药物。【原文：Orchard Therapeutics, a unit of Japan's Kyowa Kirin , priced its newly approved gene therapy for a rare, life-threatening genetic disease on Wednesday at $4.25 million, making it the most expensive drug in the United States.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称华盛顿施压奥地利瑞孚信放弃与俄罗斯富豪的交易
item.description: 几位直接了解谈判情况的人士说，美国正在向在俄罗斯最大的西方银行奥地利莱弗森国际银行施压，要求其放弃收购一位俄罗斯大亨的 15 亿欧元（16 亿美元）工业股份的计划。【原文：The United States is pressing Austria's Raiffeisen Bank International, the biggest Western bank in Russia, to drop plans to buy a 1.5 billion euro ($1.6 billion)industrial stake of a Russian tycoon, several people with direct knowledge of the talks said.】

item.title: 印度阿卡萨公司首席执行官表示，随着该公司走向国际市场，波音飞机的交付也将步入正轨
item.description: 印度阿卡萨航空公司（Akasa Air）首席执行官表示，该公司有信心按时交付其订购的波音737 MAX喷气机，尽管在今年的一次空中事故后，美国飞机制造商的737生产计划受到了严格审查。【原文：India's Akasa Air is confident that deliveries of its ordered Boeing 737 MAX jets will be on time, its CEO said, despite concerns over the U.S. planemaker's production schedule for 737s amid intense scrutiny after a mid-air incident this year.】
